articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Democratic Congo 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, on Saturday on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message wished the president of the country great success in his work for achieving its political stability and consolidating its national unity and the friendly people of Democratic Congo progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Syria
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Syria 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Riyad Hijab upon his appointment as prime minister of Syria on June 28.
					 Reassuring him of the DPRK's invariable support and solidarity for the government and people of Syria in the efforts to defend sovereignty, peace and security and achieve the economic development, the premier sincerely wished the prime minister of Syria success in his responsible job.
					
					 Meantime, Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister, also sent a similar message to Walid AlÔºçMuallem upon his reappointment as deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and Expatriates of Syria.

articles.title: CPRK Secretariat Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Purchase U.S.-made Weapons
articles.content:
CPRK Secretariat Slams Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Purchase U.S.-made Weapons
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors of south Korea is mulling concluding a contract with the U.S. on purchasing U.S.-made weapons by spending a stupendous amount of money. In this regard the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) released information bulletin No. 1002 on Saturday.
					 It said:
					
					 The Lee group set it as its "top-priority state task" before the end of the tenure of its office to conclude the contract on the purchase of U.S.-made weapons worth more than ten billion dollars this year. It requested the U.S. to sell weapons worth more than 1.409 billion dollars for the present, including multi-purpose helicopters, missiles and ultra-modern guided missiles. 
					
					 The group went the lengths of contemplating introducing even fighters still in the process of development within its term of office by concluding the assessment of them through simulation flight, not through test flight. 
					
					 The Lee group's moves are reckless acts of escalating military confrontation in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia, sparking off an arms race and rendering the situation strained, the bulletin noted, and continued:
					
					 It is the black-hearted intention of the Lee group to run the whole gamut of treachery as pro-U.S. stooges before the end of its term of office so that it may please its master, meet its own interests, incite confrontation with fellow countrymen and keep even the next "government" under the U.S. yoke.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never remain a passive onlooker to such moves of the Lee group. The group will be held fully accountable for all ensuing consequences, the bulletin warned.

articles.title: DPRK Woman Exposes S. Korean Puppet Group's Alluring Tactics and Miserable Plight of "Defectors from North" (1)
articles.content:
DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home (1) 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman Pak Jong Suk was interviewed by Korean and foreign reporters at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					 She returned home after being taken away to south Korea.
					
					 She laid bare the truth behind the rackets over "defectors from the north" kicked off by the south Korean puppet regime and their miserable plight.
					
					 Pak who had resided in Rapuk-dong No. 1, Ranam District of Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, told the conference how she was taken away to south Korea.
					
					 According to her, she illegally crossed the border on the night of March 29, 2006 in a foolish hope of meeting in China her father who was believed to live in south Korea and getting money from him.
					
					 Reaching the northeastern part of China, she wandered about in search of an abiding place. At last she was allowed to enter a brick house. 
					
					 She said: 
					
					 "The master of the house spoke Korean. Hearing my story, he discussed something with his son and let me stay in a dugout.
					
					 "One day he told me that when there is a phone call for me I should not say anything else except answering the questions put by the caller. Afterwards, the phone rang. The caller asked me my name, date of my birth and brothers and sisters before ringing off.
					
					 "3-4 days later, the master of the house told me that if I were to meet my father, I should go to Qingdao by ship. Then he brought me in a car to a place in Dalian where I stayed for about a week. One day a man who claimed to be 'a manager' took a photo of me. I learned later that he was bribed by the puppet regime and had the job of taking away people from the DPRK to south Korea. Two days later, he appeared and said it was time for me to leave for meeting my father. Then he let me get on a car and drove it to a place I could not know. I was thus handed over to this or that man according to a scenario of the puppet group. 
					
					 "At around 4 p.m. on June 28 I got aboard a 'ship bound for Qingdao' together with a woman at Dandong Port. At around 9 a.m. next day when the ship anchored, the woman threw my fake certificate into waters before getting it off. And she told me to wait for someone approaching me before a W.C. on the ground floor of a building before disappearing. Then a man took me to the second floor of the building.
					
					 "When I opened the door and entered a room, an overbearing man with a longish face took something to drink out of a box on the desk and offered it to me. He said in a cynical tone, 'This is a drug making everybody speak only truth. You are in south Korea.' 
					
					 "The enemies asked me about my career, how I lived in the DPRK, etc. and told me to write about them. They coaxed and threatened me. They went the lengths of insulting me and even making a fool of me. 
					
					 "It was not until I was questioned for about 20 days that I was allowed to go to see my father. But my father was lying on a hospital bed after undergoing an operation on the brain. He was a human vegetable unable to see or hear. It was only at that time that I realized I was deceived by the enemies".

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Commission of Quality Control headed by Chairman Choe Kwang Rae left here on Saturday to visit Vietnam and China.
					 A public health delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk also left here to attend a high-level meeting for preparing the 65th Meeting of the Southeast Asian Region of the WHO.
					
					 A delegation of the Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung returned home on the same day after visiting Russia.
					
					 Departing here for home on Saturday was the delegation of the Christian Democratic People's Party of Switzerland headed by Rene Imoberdorf, member of the Council of State from the party.

articles.title: Vice-Chairman of S. Headquarters of Pomminryon Tours Different Places of DPRK
articles.content:
Vice-Chairman of S. Headquarters of Pomminryon Tours Different Places of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), visited the Grand People's Study House in Pyongyang.
					 He looked round various reading and lecture rooms, being briefed on the fact that at the splendidly furnished study house working people and students of the DPRK are acquiring modern scientific and technological knowledge and improving their cultural attainments.
					
					 He also toured different places of Pyongyang and other areas. They included the Three-Revolution Exhibition, Korean Art Gallery, Pyongyang Metro, Sinuiju Cosmetic Factory, Sinuiju Ponbu Kindergarten and the Sinam Cooperative Farm in Ryongchon County.

articles.title: Swedish Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Swedish Delegation Tours Pyongyang 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Swedish parliamentarians from the ruling coalition parties led by Johan Linander, member of the Executive Committee of the Centre Party of Sweden who is vice-chairman of the Judicial Affairs Committee of the Parliament, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President  Kim Il Sung.
					 The members of the delegation looked round historic relics preserved at the old home of the President, being briefed on his revolutionary career and his family members.
					
					 It visited the e-library of Kim Il Sung University, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Hana Music Information Center, the Pyongyang Metro and other places.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers led by its Secretary General Julien Huck Saturday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill.
					 The guests laid a floral basket before the statues and made bows.
					
					 The delegation arrived here on Saturday.

articles.title: Int'l Tour of Mt. Kumgang by Boat Starts
articles.content:
Int'l Tour of Mt. Kumgang by Boat Starts 
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The international tour of Mt. Kumgang by Rason-Mt. Kumgang Boat started on Friday. 
					 The tourists will spend pleasant days, while visiting different places of superb scenic beauty in Mt. Kumgang including Kuryong Falls, Manmulsang (myriad-shaped peaks), Lagoon Samil and Sea Kumgang and enjoying a bird's-eye-view of the scenery of the picturesque east coast of Korea.

articles.title: Much Rain Sets in Most Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Much Rain Sets in Most Areas of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Heavy rain hit most areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on Friday and Saturday.
					 West coastal areas had rainfalls in about 70 days, accompanied by downpour. More than 90 mm of rainfall was observed in Pyongyang, North Phyongan Province and North and South Hwanghae provinces, while over 50 mm in other areas.
					
					 Over 30 mm was measured in east coastal areas and northern areas.
					
					 On Saturday it rained 50 mm in Sonchon County, North Phyongan Province between 00:00 and 03:00 and 51 mm in Phyongsan County, North Hwanghae Province between 03:00 and 06:00.
					
					 Meanwhile, the wind of 10 meters per second hit some areas of South Phyongan and North and South Hwanghae provinces.

articles.title: AFC "B" License Award Coaching Course in Pyongyang
articles.content:
AFC "B" License Award Coaching Course in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- AFC "B" license award coaching course is now going on at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang.
					 Taking part in it are football coaches from various sports teams and teachers of juvenile sports schools.
					
					 According to an official concerned, the course deals with such matters as method of physical and technical training, offense and defense tactics, players' mentality and recovery from fatigue.
					
					 In the course which is to last until July 11, there will be also presentation of essays and three examinations for license.
					
					 The course is officiated by Robert Lim, a lecturer of AFC.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Beats Its Cambodian Rival 3:0
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Beats Its Cambodian Rival 3:0
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK soccer team Saturday shut out its Cambodian rival 3:0 in a Group F preliminary match of the AFC under 22 Soccer Championship.
					It will play its last match with its Chinese rival on July 3.

articles.title: U.S. Can Never Cover up Its True Colors as Provocateur of Korean War
articles.content:
U.S. Can Never Cover up Its True Colors as Provocateur of Korean War 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- It is 62 years since the U.S. ignited the Korean War.
					 The Korean War ignited by the U.S. on June 25, 1950 imposed unspeakable misfortune and sufferings on the Korean people, causing tremendous human and material losses.
					
					 The U.S. has, however, falsified the truth of history and persisted in its moves to stifle the DPRK. 
					
					 This is a foolish act to evade the responsibility as the provocateur of the Korean War and realize its wild ambition for domination.
					
					 Historical facts bring to bolder relief the true colors of the U.S. as provocateur of the Korean War and a war criminal.
					
					 The Korean War was an inevitable product of the U.S. strategy for putting the world under its control. 
					
					 It was pursuant to the U.S. foreign policy for aggression and its direct result.
					
					 The U.S. set it as an immediate strategic goal of its foreign policy to establish "leadership over the world" and dominate the world by taking advantage of its favorable position in which it emerged the boss of the imperialists after the end of World War II.
					
					 U.S. President Truman in his "message" sent to Congress on December 19, 1945, said that at last it became possible for the U.S. to get the leadership position which U.S. President Wilson had wished to grant to it after the end of World War I, adding that it should assume with pleasure the mission to "lead the world".
					
					 In order to realize its wild ambition to dominate the world the U.S. declared the Cold War against the growing socialist countries and world revolutionary forces and came out with what it called "containment strategy."
					
					 The so-called Truman Doctrine spelled out by Truman at a joint meeting of the U.S. Senate and House of Representatives in March 1947 was an open declaration of a war against the socialist forces and the world independent forces and a declaration that called for carrying out its strategy for world domination and "containment strategy" in real earnest.
					
					 The proclamation of "Truman Doctrine" and the establishment of the above-said strategy meant that the U.S. launched an "anti-communist crusade expedition."
					
					 The U.S. attached importance to the Far East in Asia in carrying out its strategy for dominating the world.
					
					 MacArthur, commander of the U.S. forces in Fart East and commander of the UN forces during the three-year Korean War, said at that time that Europe had a dying system but Asia having 800 million population would decide on the advance of the world history in 1 000 years to come, adding that the U.S. will lose the whole world if it fails to put Asia under its control.
					
					 The U.S. reactionary government ostensively advocated the policy of putting main emphasis on Europe but it enforced the policy of attaching importance to Asia in practice under the influence of "those advocating Asia first" including MacArthur.
					
					 They attached great importance to Korea, in particular, among Asian countries, 
					
					 "Top secret document No. 4849" of the Information Research Bureau of the U.S. Department of State on January 28, 1949 said that in the light of Korea's geographical situation in Northeast Asia to control Korea and its people was of value to any other states interested in the Far East and it was beyond any doubt that Korea was very important for the U.S. from the political point of view.
					
					 For its military and strategic position of Korea the U.S. regarded it as a strategic stronghold for making a military strike at any region in the Far East and as a " bridgehead" and a "forefront in the Far East" from which to intrude into China and the Far Eastern region of the Soviet Union.
					
					 To cite just an example, MacArthur was reported to say that Korea was like a bridgehead leading to the continent and that conquering the whole of Korea would help the U.S. forces cut off the only supply line linking Siberia of the Soviet Union with its southern parts and put the whole areas between Vladivostok and Singapore under the U.S. control.
					
					 The U.S. also said Korea was the forefront in the East where it was standing in confrontation with communism and a political and military confrontational hotspot between the East and the West as the north and the south of Korea were taking quite different paths after the end of World War II.
					
					 Much upset by the fact that the DPRK was making a leaping advance toward socialism, bringing about epoch-making changes, the U.S. termed Korea an "ideal battle site on which every possible success of the U.S. in Asia might hinge" and a "testing ground for the confrontation between the U.S.-style democracy and communism." 
					
					 This finally prompted the U.S. to adopt it as a basic policy toward the DPRK to colonize the whole of Korea by means of war.
					
					 The U.S. considered war as an effective lever for bringing down the people's democratic system deeply rooted in the DPRK and imposing aggressive demands upon its people strong in independence. 
					
					 The U.S. illegally brought the issue of Korea up for discussion at the UN in autumn of 1947, cooking up the puppet regime in south Korea in 1948 and worked hard to build "Asia's best" puppet army. All this was aimed at meeting these demands.
					
					 As seen above, the Korean War was an inevitable product of the U.S. brigandish strategy and policy for aggression toward the DPRK, both aimed to colonize the whole of Korea and realize its scenario for dominating the world in the Far East, using it as an outpost. 
					
					 The U.S. was keenly interested in the Korean War also because of its serious economic crisis at that time.
					
					 Economic depression started in the light industrial field at the end of 1948 and then caused a chain reaction in the heavy industry. It rapidly hit iron and steel industry in March 1949. As a result, about 4 600 companies went bankrupt in the first half of that year, causing a huge surplus work force. The number of the full unemployed was expected to increase to 13 million within 1950. The profits of monopolies drastically dropped to 28.4 billion U.S. dollars in March 1949 from 36.6 billion U.S. dollars in September 1948.
					
					 The monopoly tycoons of the U.S. urged the ruling quarters of the administration to start a new war, expecting the government to make preparations for giving a fresh strong shot in the arm of economy.
					
					 "War for prosperity!" was a call of U.S. monopoly capitalists who were struggling to rid of the crisis caused by over-production.
					
					 The reactionary government speaking for the interests of the U.S. billionaires finally put spurs to the war preparations, stepping up militarization of economy and arms race.
					
					 Arms race unprecedented in peacetime in the U.S. history was kicked off with 1948 when economic crisis started as a momentum and the horror of economic crisis reached at its height in 1950. The Korean War broke out that year against this background. 
					
					 Commenting on this, Japanese book "Korean War" said that "Korean War was a way-out of economic crisis that faced the U.S."
					
					  The U.S. ignited the Korean War also because the puppet regimes in Asia were on the verge of collapse.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime of Syngman Rhee faced a serious ruling crisis after its shameful defeat at the puppet National Assembly election on May 30, 1950.
					
					 The Rhee clique held just 47 seats out of 210 seats in the NA while the "faction calling for negotiations with the north" dominated it.
					
					 If a "presidential election" was held under that balance of forces in the NA, it was very likely that a "candidate from the middle faction" would be elected.
					
					 As an American historian commented, a war was "the last hope" of the Rhee clique to survive under that situation and it was to ignite a fratricidal war as soon as possible.
					
					 Traitor Syngman Rhee sent Jang Myon to Washington to inform it of the fact that the "government" might collapse around June 10 - 13 and "asked for prompt U.S. assistance" to help him weather the crisis.
					
					 Upon receiving an urgent message from Rhee, Truman had to prevent the collapse of the puppet government in south Korea as there was no other way for him but to "support him" and had no option but to ignite the projected war as early as possible, as he confessed. 
					
					 Another reason for the U.S to decide to go to war was the information that the Chinese people were planning to liberate Taiwan in summer of 1950.
					
					 According to what was confessed by Mun Hak Bong, former advisor to the CIC and political advisor to Syngman Rhee, the U.S. received information that the Chinese people would conduct an operation for liberating Taiwan in July, at the latest, and came to make a decision to take an initiative. This prompted the U.S. to advance the date of the start of the Korean War. 
					
					 The United States fixed June 25 as the date for starting the Korean War. Lurking behind this was a crafty plot to cover up its true colors as a war provocateur.
					
					 Historically, the "tactics of making a surprise attack at dawn of Sunday" was a trite method employed by the imperialists.
					
					 The Russo-Japanese War, the Sino-Japanese War and the Pacific War were all kicked off with surprise attacks early Sunday mornings.
					
					 The U.S. added a new meaning to this method. 
					
					 It was proved by what Robert, head of the U.S. military advisory group, told Syngman Rhee.
					
					 Explaining the reason why the U.S. chose June 25 for the start of the war, Robert said June 25 was Sunday and no one would believe that the Christian states, the U.S. and south Korea, would ignite a war on Sunday as they observe the Sabbath. 
					
					 In other words, the decision was intended to make people believe that neither the U.S. nor south Korea provoked the war first, Robert said.
					
					 The U.S. set in motion its paid media to release the following false report in a bid to cover up its true colors as a war provocateur: Two third of the south Korean puppet troops had an off-day on June 24 when the "preparatory martial law" that had been proclaimed on June 13 was lifted.   All brass hats of the units deployed in the areas along the 38th Parallel above divisional commanders took part in a "ball" held at a club of the puppet ground force in Seoul on that evening.
					
					 But Ri Song Ga, commander of the 8th Division of the south Korean army deployed in the eastern sector of the front at that time, testified to the fact that all the puppet forces in the area along the 38th Parallel were on combat alert after being ordered not to leave their barracks on the eve of June 25 and launched an attack at dawn.
					
					 With nothing can the U.S. cover its true colors as a war provocateur. It can never escape a severe punishment by history.
					
					 The U.S. is instigating the south Korean puppet forces and the Japanese reactionaries to ignite the second Korean war, a nuclear war, instead of drawing a due lesson from its bitter defeat in the last Korean war,
					
					 If the belligerent forces of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces dare provoke another war, oblivious of the lesson taught by history, they will face a strong counter-action of the army and people of the DPRK and meet a miserable end. Those who do not want peace but seek a war should bear this in mind.

articles.title: Patriotism Displayed by DPRK People in Korean War
articles.content:
Patriotism Displayed by DPRK People in Korean War
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Korean War (June 1950-July 1953) was a showdown in politico-ideological, moral and military aspects between the young Democratic People's Republic of Korea, which was liberated five years ago from Japan's colonial rule, and the United States boasting of its "invincibility".
					 During the war the people of the DPRK gave full play to patriotism.
					
					 For six weeks after the outbreak of war more than one million youths volunteered for service in the army. They fought at the risk of their lives to defend their social system which put forward them as the masters of the country liberated by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Among them were heroes Ri Su Bok, Kang Ho Yong, An Yong Ae and Jo Kun Sil, who did not hesitate to dedicate their precious lives to the defence of the country.
					
					 On the other hand, the American soldiers, ideologically and morally corrupt, were in low morale, seized with fear of death.
					
					 According to data of the U.S. imperialist aggression army, 46 000 servicepersons deserted their units in the navy in the period from the beginning of the war to late 1952. In the army 20 000 ran away on a monthly average, 3 000 a day sometimes.
					
					 At that time a Western writer said, as regards the mentality of the two warring sides, that the U.S. and south Korean troops were running away like sheep while the DPRK army was fighting like tiger.
					
					 Soldiers of the U.S. allies deplored that their right in the Korean War was only to advance under a rain of shells in every battle and then bury their dead fellows in an alien land.
					
					 The U.S. forces and their mercenaries, armed with advanced weapons, could not match the DPRK people courageously fighting for their leader and country.
					
					 Inspired by the President's unique military idea and Juche-based war tactics, the army and people of the DPRK fully displayed their patriotism in the war, setting an example in the anti-imperialist revolutionary war.

articles.title: Juche Idea, Founded by Kim Il Sung in His Teens
articles.content:
Juche Idea, Founded by Kim Il Sung in His Teens
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- It was on June 30, Juche 19 (1930) that President Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea as the guiding idea of the Korean revolution.
					 He convened a historic meeting in Kalun of China when Korea was at stake due to the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and the revolutionary forces were suffering a big loss because of the factional elements' misdeeds.
					
					 At the meeting, he made a report titled "The Path of the Korean Revolution."
					
					 In the report he clarified the Juche-based theory and principles of revolution; The popular masses are responsible for the revolutionary struggle, and this struggle can emerge victorious only when they are mobilized. Accordingly, the Korean revolution should be made by the Korean people themselves in keeping with their country's specific conditions.
					
					 Kim Il Sung also said the nature of the Korean revolution was the anti-imperialist, anti-feudal democratic revolution and that the motive force of the revolution included the anti-Japanese patriotic people from all walks of life, including workers, peasants, intellectuals, non-comprador capitalists and religionists.
					
					 He advanced the line of armed struggle and other unique lines and policies in the report.
					
					 Indeed, the President was a prominent thinker and theoretician as he set forth the new guiding idea and lines of the revolution in his teens.
					
					 Led by him, the Korean revolution made steady and victorious advance under the banner of the Juche idea. 
					
					 Today the Juche idea serves as the guiding idea in the era of independence for its scientific accuracy and truth.

articles.title: All Koreans Urged to Implement Inter-Korean Declarations: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
All Koreans Urged to Implement Inter-Korean Declarations: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- All Koreans at home and abroad should energetically advance the new era of independent reunification, meeting all challenges of the anti-reunification forces under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article. It goes on:
					
					 The June 15 Joint Declaration and the October 4 Declaration are an independent reunification programme in the new era as they indicate the most correct principle and ways for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration was provided in reflection of the basic nature and realistic requirement of the issue of Korea's reunification and the unanimous desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 Amid the vigorous trend of the June 15 era of reunification, the October 4 declaration was adopted as an action program for independent reunification, peace and prosperity, and this put the inter-Korean relations on a higher stage of development.
					
					 The Korean nation's effort to defend and implement the declarations should always be the struggle to foil the actions of the anti-reunification forces against the trend of the times.
					
					 If the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea stays in power, it will mean just the revival of the Lee Myung Bak conservative regime opposed to those declarations.
					
					 If the party which is opposed to the declarations is allowed to seize power again, it would again become impossible to implement those declarations and realize the long-cherished desire of the Korean nation for peace and independent reunification.
					
					 The Korean nation is firmly convinced that if all compatriots at home and abroad get united to defend and implement the declarations despite the desperate moves of the anti-reunification forces, the new phase of national reunification is sure to be opened.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Finding Way-out of Economic Crisis in War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses U.S. of Finding Way-out of Economic Crisis in War
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Historically, the imperialists found a way-out of the economic crisis in a war, says DPRK major paper Rodong Sinmun on Saturday in a bylined article.
					 The article cites data of the economic depressions that led to a war, saying the imperialists openly disclosed their fascist ambitions when they were on the brink of bankruptcy.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists began to seek a way-out of their domestic political and economic crisis in igniting a new war, the third world war, says the article, adding:
					
					 They considered a war as the only "cardiac" that would help them get out of the political and economic crisis.
					
					 "War is requisite for prosperity!" -- this was a call of the monopoly capitalists in grip of the economic depression and a slogan of the U.S. imperialists to ignite a fresh war.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists have already pinpointed the DPRK, gateway to Asia, as the target of a new war.
					
					 With the 1950s beginning, the horror of the economic depression reached its extremity in the U.S. It put the imperialists in a position unable to delay the Korean War any longer.
					
					 At last on June 25, 1950, the U.S. imperialists provoked the Korean War.
					
					 Many years have passed since then. However, the U.S. imperialists remain unchanged in their trite methods to find a way-out of the economic depression in a war.
					
					 The imperialists' political and economic crisis has been getting more serious. The U.S. imperialists have also become undisguised in making provocations against the DPRK in a bid to ignite a fresh war against it.
					
					 But their attempts will bring earlier their self-destruction.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists would be well advised not to go reckless, drawing lessons from the past Korean War.

articles.title: Hegemonic Forces' Moves Are Bound to Misfire: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Hegemonic Forces' Moves Are Bound to Misfire: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The imperialist forces can never stem the advance of the world toward independence and multipolarization no matter how desperately they may make efforts. This is truth proven by the international situation in June.
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists who are going against peace have beefed up their armed forces in an unprecedented manner in the world including the Asia-Pacific region, in the waters off the Korean Peninsula, in particular. The Japanese militarist forces have intensified their moves to turn Japan into a military giant and realize nuclear weaponization, availing themselves of the U.S. strategy.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is inching toward a war and the region of Northeast Asia is embroiled in a fresh arms race due to the reckless military racket of the U.S. All these circumstances clearly prove that the U.S. is the chief culprit of destroying peace and security in the peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 Progressive countries and people have made strenuous efforts to build an independent and peaceful new world defying the escalated criminal moves of the imperialist and domination forces.
					
					 Leaders of Mexico, Peru and Chile signed a treaty of founding a Pacific union, member nations of the Organization of American States (OAS) declared that they would reform the U.S.-led OAS to end its existing system and Russia has made positive efforts for founding a Eurasian union.
					
					 Meanwhile, international efforts have been boosted for settling disputes and achieving peace and stability.
					
					 The more desperately the imperialist and domination forces make efforts to enforce their hegemonic and high-handed policy, the fiercer the regional organizations become in opposing their moves. Nothing can block this dynamic stream.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Traitor Lee Myung Bak of His Reckless Remarks against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Traitor Lee Myung Bak of His Reckless Remarks against DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, while touring Central and South American countries, begged for international cooperation everywhere he went, asserting that "the north should be barred from its  nuclear and missile development."  He went the lengths of blustering that the south would not allow the north's "provocations."
					 Meanwhile, he, talking about "forces following the north" again, claimed "they would not get support" as part of the campaign for fanning up the "coloring operation."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The cascade of invective let loose by the traitor against compatriots during his foreign junkets is shame on the nation.
					
					  Lee should have controlled himself in his demeanor even a bit outside south Korea as he is hard hit by all sides for his wrong behavior almost every day inside it. But he was so blinded with confrontation with compatriots that he brought his true colors to light, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 He is now finding himself utterly helpless, forsaken by the south Korean people. The malignant mud-slinging again made by Lee against the DPRK was intended to get rid of his miserable position by realizing international cooperation in the anti-DPRK campaign through mendicant diplomacy. This is disgusting diplomacy which can be conducted only by such traitor and stooge of outside forces as Lee.
					
					 In making speeches during his foreign trips, Lee did not forget to utter words "forces following the north." This was aimed to justify his policy of confrontation and stamp out progressive forces of different social standings in south Korea who wish to achieve reunification through an alliance with the north by linking them with the DPRK.
					
					 His outbursts only betray his consciousness of crisis in which he feels extremely uneasy after becoming the target to be eliminated by the people. Lee, though a dying politician, is working hard to improve his public image through "summit diplomacy" and the like. But his impertinent remarks only touch off derision and disgust among people.
					
					 The prevailing situation goes to prove that the traitor without an equal in the world should be eliminated as early as possible if the Korean nation is to escape a disaster.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Authorities Slammed for Pressurizing Media
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Authorities Slammed for Pressurizing Media
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- A south Korean Internet paper on June 18 carried an article accusing the south Korean authorities of pressurizing media in a bid to cover up the truth about the illegal investigation into civilians.
					 The article dealt with the recent disclosure of the fact that Chongwadae pressurized some media to "make a balanced coverage" in the run-up to the announcement of the results of the prosecution's survey of illegal investigation by ruling quarters. 
					
					 When this sparked off public furor, Chongwadae made such excuse as saying it was no more than a request, the article noted, adding:
					
					 The "government" authorities behaved so foolishly as to investigate the journalist who released a news item clarifying the chief culprit of the illegal investigation.
					
					 The recently disclosed pressure by Chongwadae is no more than a tip of iceberg, the article held, charging:
					
					 In a word, Lee Myung Bak is more impudent than any other military dictators in the past.

articles.title: S. Korean Progressive Media Man Calls for Achieving National Reunification
articles.content:
S. Korean Media Man Calls for Achieving National Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, an Internet paper of south Korea, on June 12 posted on its Internet website the poem "Reunification" written by its Representative Ri Chang Gi now behind bars.
					 The poem says that those talking about sinister "expenses for reunification" inciting war and confrontation are nothing but snobs utterly indifferent to the nation.
					
					 Accusing the present "government" of begging outsiders to render cooperation to it in carrying out its policy of opposing reunification and pursuing confrontation, leveling guns at fellow countrymen, the poem deplored for how long the nation has to suffer shame in the eyes of the world.
					
					 Only when the south and the north of Korea achieve the independent and peaceful reunification free from foreign forces' interference, can the Korean nation fully exalt its dignity as a prosperous and powerful nation, and achieve peace on the Korean Peninsula, the poem said.
					
					 It expressed towering anger at those who are foolish enough to persistently trumpet about the "expenses for reunification," a hurdle lying in the way of reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Papers Accuse Puppet Group of Opting to Conclude Military Agreement with Japan
articles.content:
S. Korean Papers Accuse "Government" of Opting to Conclude Military Agreement with Japan
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- South Korean papers carried editorials on June 28 denouncing the "government" for attempting to conclude a military agreement with Japan. 
					 Kyunghyang Daily News in an editorial said that the "government" secretly railroaded the GSOMIA through its "Cabinet meeting" on June 26 as an initial phase for concluding a military agreement with Japan. 
					
					  The editorial accuses the "government" authorities of concealing the true aim of the agreement under the pretext of "security threat growing owing to the north's missile launch and nuclear development," etc.
					
					 Lurking behind the conclusion of the military agreement with Japan is a new military strategy of the U.S. and the U.S. administration, pursuant to this strategy, is pressurizing south Korea to strengthen military cooperation with Japan, it noted.
					
					  It urged the authorities to stop the moves to conclude the agreement with Japan and lend an ear to the public opinion.
					
					  Hankuk Ilbo in an editorial said that no one can vouch that Japan's attitude raising a claim to Tok Islets and denying its past crimes would not threaten the security of south Korea.
					
					 Given the facts that Japan took legal steps for nuclear weaponization recently and is making desperate efforts to steadily bolster its military potential, the conclusion of the military agreement would encourage Japan in its militarist ambition, the editorial stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Plan to Conclude Military Agreement with Japan under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Plan to Conclude Military Agreement with Japan under Fire
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps of south Korea in a commentary on June 27 denounced the puppet government for seeking to conclude a military agreement with Japan, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 In the face of increasing rebuff from the people from all walks of life against the moves to conclude military agreement with Japan, the authorities secretly approved the GSOMIA at a "Cabinet meeting" on June 26, the organization said, and went on:
					
					 This will fuel the military conflict in Northeast Asia and instigate the revival of Japan's militarism.
					
					 The organization urged the "government" to stop the attempt and make an apology to the people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in Bulletin of Mexican Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried in Bulletin of Mexican Organization
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea" was carried by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism in its bulletin No. 71.
					 The work, published on March 31, 1982, deals with the undying historic feats of President Kim Il Sung, who founded the Juche idea, and their significance, the philosophical principle of the Juche idea, its socio-historical principles, guiding principles, etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Speech Carried by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Speech Carried by Nepali Paper
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Arpan on June 22 carried the detailed gist of a congratulatory speech made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday on June 6, 2012. 
					 He in his speech expressed his steadfast will to invariably carry forward the noble outlook of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on the future and the rising generation.
					
					 He also indicated tasks and ways for bringing up the KCU members to be reserves, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, who will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation. 
					
					 The paper carried his portrait.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Meetings, reading sessions and remembrance meetings took place in Bangladesh, Uganda and Cambodia between June 16 and 18 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Bangladesh and other speakers said Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the WPK was a special event of great significance in strengthening the WPK. The undying feats he performed in leading the WPK along the path of victory with his matchless extraordinary political ability will be recorded in the hearts of progressive mankind forever, they noted.
					
					 The chairman of the Lugazi Branch of the Uganda-DPRK Friendship Association said Kim Jong Il was an outstanding thinker and theoretician, the great master of leadership and leader who is alive in the hearts of the progressives.
					
					 The president of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia noted: 
					
					 The WPK could become a powerful and authorized party thanks to the feats of Kim Jong Il in party building.
					
					 A meeting, photo exhibition and film show were held in France and a film show in Dominica on June 16 and 19 on the occasions of the 48th anniversary of his start of work at the WPK Central Committee and the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Introduced
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Introduced 
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups and articles on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Cambodian paper Pracheachon on June 13 carried a special write-up under the title "Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of WPK" with his photo. It said: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il put forward the programme on imbuing the whole party and society with the Juche idea, the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung, the founder of the WPK, and conducted energetic activities for its implementation. The feats he performed in strengthening the WPK constitute precious heritage left by him for the country and the people and a foundation guaranteeing the eternal future of the WPK.
					
					 AKP of Cambodia on June 19 carried an article praising his undying feats in party building.
					
					 The Indian paper Passion India on June 16 carried an article which says:
					
					 The DPRK is dynamically advancing along the road of socialism under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un despite the moves of the imperialists to stifle it. This clearly proves the validity and vitality of Kim Jong Il's ideology.
					
					 On the same day the Indian paper Tourism Era devoted one whole page to articles titled "Turning WPK into mother party", "Event to be specially recorded in WPK's history" and "Bright future of DPRK" with his photo.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Natun Katha on June 15 carried an article titled "Single-minded unity and Kim Jong Il" in which it praised his undying feats in party building.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea and the MS Tourism Company of Germany on June 17 and 19 posted on their Internet homepages articles praising his feats in party building.

articles.title: June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Is Immutable Banner for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
June 15 North-South Joint Declaration Is Immutable Banner for Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- Foreign media marked the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Cambodian AKP on June 10 said:
					
					 A north-south summit was made in Pyongyang in June 2000, in which the issue of Korea's reunification was discussed.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il made energetic activities to make sure that the joint declaration reflecting the fundamental guidelines and basic ideology to be maintained in carrying out the country's reunification was adopted.
					
					 After the lapse of 10 odd years since then, the idea of "By our nation itself", the basic idea of the June 15 joint declaration, is still shining as an immutable banner of Korea's reunification.
					
					 AKP repeatedly aired the same content on June 15.
					
					 An Equatorial Guinean radio on June 14 said:
					
					 12 years ago, Kim Jong Il met Kim Dae Jung, president of south Korea, who visited Pyongyang and made sure that the North-South Joint Declaration, most important guidelines for reunification, was adopted. 
					
					 This was fully supported and welcomed by not only the Korean people but also the world people.
					
					 We are sure that the Koreans' efforts will bear a fruit.
					
					 The Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor on June 14 carried an article titled "June 15 for Reunification" introducing the exploits performed by Kim Jong Il by opening up the era of June 15 reunification.
					
					 The general director for Administrative Affairs of the Union of Myanmar Economic Holdings Limited said that the bright prospect for Korea's independent reunification was opened up by the adoption of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.

articles.title: Okinawa Assembly Adopts Resolution against Osprey Deployment
articles.content:
Okinawa Assembly Adopts Resolution against Osprey Deployment
						
 Pyongyang, June 30 (KCNA) -- The Okinawa Prefectural Assembly adopted a resolution Tuesday opposing the planned deployment of the MV-22 Osprey at the U.S. Marine Corps' Futenma Air Base amid safety concerns over the military transport aircraft in the wake of a series of incidents involving the aircraft.
					 The resolution says the governments of Japan and the United States are aiming to impose the Osprey on Okinawa against the wishes of the prefecture that the risks posed to the local community by the Futenma base will be removed as soon as possible.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Joseph Kabila Kabange
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Joseph Kabila Kabange
						
Pyongyang, 30 de junio (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 52o aniversario de la independencia de la Republica Democratica del Congo, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 30 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de ese pais africano, Joseph Kabila Kabange.
					En su misiva, el remitente deseo al destinatario grandes exitos en su labor para consolidar la estabilidad politica del pais y la unidad nacional y a su amistoso pueblo el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Espiritus contrarios de ambas partes beligerantes en guerra coreana
articles.content:
Espiritus contrarios de ambas partes beligerantes en guerra coreana
						
Pyongyang, 30 de junio (ACNC) -- La pasada guerra coreana (junio de 1950-julio de 1953) fue un enfrentamiento militar, politico, ideologico, espiritual y moral entre el pueblo coreano recien liberado de la esclavitud colonial de Japon, y el imperialismo norteamericano, que se vanagloriaba de la "victoria".
					En esa guerra el pueblo coreano mostro sin reserva el espiritu patriotico.
					
					A seis semanas despues del estallido de la guerra, un millon y cientos de miles de jovenes coreanos solicitaron a ingresarse en el ejercito.
					
					El pueblo coreano convertido en el dueno de la tierra, las fabricas y el pais en la patria liberada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, combatio a riesgo de su vida para defender su ventajoso regimen.
					
					Ri Su Bok, Kang Ho Yong, An Yong Ae, Jo Kun Sil y otros muchos heroes sacrificaron la juventud y la vida sin vacilacion alguna para defender la patria.
					
					Al contrario, en aquel tiempo, vino al suelo el animo de los uniformados norteamericanos corrompidos en lo espiritual y moral.
					
					Los agresores se temblaban en cada momento por el pavor de muerte.
					
					De acuerdo con los datos disponibles de las tropas agresoras yanquis, huyeron desde el dia de inicio de la guerra hasta finales de 1952 de sus unidades 46 mil soldados de las fuerzas navales, y en las terrestres 20 mil como promedio mensual, de vez en cuando tres mil soldados al dia.
					
					Un escritor del Occidente dijo que el ejercito norcoreano lucho como tigre y el norteamericano y surcoreano huian como oveja.
					
					Los soldados del "ejercito aliado" apuntaron que en Corea ellos mismos tienen el unico derecho a avanzar hacia el canonazo en el momento de combate mas violento y enterrar a sus colegas en el territorio ajeno.
					
					Esto es el reflejo del espiritu de los uniformados norteamericanos y otros aliados, que se jactaban de "supremacia" en el mundo.
					
					Aunque fueron armados con equipos modernos, los mercenarios a sueldo y sus patrones no pudieron doblegar al pueblo coreano que luchaba a riesgo de vida en defensa de su lider y patria. 
					
					Gracias a la original idea militar del Presidente Kim Il Sung y al espiritu patriotico de los militares y civiles coreanos armados con el autoctono metodo de guerra, durante la guerra coreana se creo un ejemplo verdadero de la guerra revolucionaria antiimperialista.

articles.title: Iniciado turismo internacional al monte Kumgang en barco
articles.content:
Iniciado turismo internacional al monte Kumgang en barco
						
Pyongyang, 30 de junio (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciado desde el dia 29 el turismo internacional al monte Kumgang en barco desde Rason.
					Los turistas podran disfrutar el panorama del lago Kuryong, Manmulsang, lago Samil, Kumgang Maritimo y otros puntos pintorescos del monte Kumgang y el Mar Este de Corea que lo rodea.

articles.title: Caen muchas lluvias en todas partes de Corea
articles.content:
Caen muchas lluvias en todas partes de Corea
						
\Pyongyang, 30 de junio (ACNC) -- Los dias 29 y 30, cayeron muchas lluvias en todas las zonas de Corea.
					En las zonas costeras occidentales, cayo una lluvia torrencial acompanada de turbonada al cabo de casi 70 dias de sequia.
					
					En la ciudad de Pyongyang y las provincias de Phyong-an del Norte, de Hwanghae del Norte y del Sur se acumularon mas de 90 mm de precipitaciones.
					
					El pluviometro marco mas de 50 mm en las demas regiones occidentales.
					
					Se reportaron mas de 30 mm en el caso de las costas orientales y zonas septentrionales del pais.
					
					Por otra parte, desde la 0 hasta las 3 del dia 30, las precipitaciones ascendieron a 50 mm en el distrito de Sonchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y desde las 3 hasta las 6 del mismo dia, a 51 mm en el distrito de Phyongsan de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					
					En algunas partes de las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur, de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte se observo hasta un viento fuerte con una velocidad de desplazamiento de mas de 10 metros por segundo.
